message.content: A metonymy is a figure of speech in which one word or phrase is substituted with another closely related to it. This type of figurative language relies on the context and shared understanding between speaker and listener, often involving a shift from literal meaning to symbolic representation. For example, "the crown" might refer not only to the physical object but also to the monarchy or royal authority itself; similarly, "Wall Street" can stand for the financial industry as a whole rather than just the street in New York City where many major banks and stock exchanges are located
